ACT
152.  
Definition and manner of division of estate
Division of an estate may be demanded by any co-successor unless the provisions of § 155 of this Act provide otherwise. Upon division of an estate, it shall be determined which things or shares of things and which rights and obligations forming part of the estate transfer to each co-successor.
An estate shall be divided among successors according to their shares of the estate, based on the usual value of the objects forming part of the estate at the time of the division. By agreement of the successors, a thing forming part of the estate may be valuated on the basis of the special interest of a successor.
Upon division of an estate, the provisions concerning division of a thing in common ownership apply unless otherwise provided by this Act.
Co-successors shall divide an estate by agreement. In the case of a dispute, a court shall divide the estate at the request of a successor.
